CROSS REFERENCES
Construction or repair at owner's expense - see Ohio R.C. 729.01 et seq.
Notice to construct or repair sidewalk - see Ohio R.C. 729.03 et seq.
Duty to keep sidewalks clean and in repair - see GEN. OFF.
521.06
 
901.01 CONSTRUCTION OR REPAIR OF SIDEWALKS.
   Whenever, in the opinion of Council, it becomes necessary to construct or
repair any sidewalk in the City, Council shall pass a resolution declaring that
it shall be so constructed or repaired. Such resolution shall describe the
sidewalk, state in what manner it is to be so constructed or repaired and what
kind of materials are to be used.
(1956 Code §303.01.)
901.02 NOTICE.
   Written notice shall be served upon the owner or agent of the owner of each
parcel of land abutting on such sidewalk. This notice shall be served by the
Clerk of Council or a person designated by the Clerk, in the manner provided by
Ohio R.C. 729.03. The Clerk shall return a copy of such notice with the time
and manner of service endorsed thereon, signed by the officer serving it, to
the Director of Public Service who shall file and preserve it.
901.03 CONSTRUCTION REQUISITES.
   (a)    Whenever written notice of the passage of a resolution declaring that
certain sidewalks shall be constructed or repaired has been received by the
owner, or agent of the owner, of each parcel of land abutting on such sidewalk,
or if the owner or agent of the owner, of any parcel of land wishes to
construct or repair his sidewalk, he shall first make application to the
Service Director for information with regard to grades, work agreement, widths,
thickness, subbase, material and methods of construction.
   (b)    The Director of Public Service, upon application from any party in
interest, interest, shall give the necessary information in regard to the grade
or other matters necessary to enable the owners of property to construct or
repair the sidewalk according to the requirements of this chapter.
901.04 GRADES.
   (a)    The owner, or agent of the owner, making application for information
regulating the construction or repair of a sidewalk shall, whenever possible,
construct the sidewalk parallel to the existing curb line or, where no curb
exists, the sidewalk shall be held parallel to the existing pavement centerline
and at a height above the curb line approved by the Service Director.
   (b)    Whenever the existing ground, pavement, adjacent sidewalks,
driveways, culverts, drainage ditches or other features will not permit the
sidewalk to be constructed parallel to existing curb or street centerlines,
then the Engineer may require that the owner, or the agent of the owner,
prepare plans indicating the proposed grade of the sidewalk and its
relationship to existing sidewalks, driveways, culverts, drainage ditches and
adjacent property. Such plans shall be prepared by a registered professional
engineer.
(Ord. 690121-12. Passed 2-4-69.)
901.05 WORK AGREEMENT.
   Whenever the construction or repair of any sidewalk requires the alteration
of adjacent property not belonging to the owner, or if it becomes necessary to
use such land in any way whatsoever, a work agreement shall be completed
between the owner and the affected property owner, and a copy of such work
agreement shall be placed on file in the office of the City Engineer prior to
beginning construction.
(Ord. 690121-12. Passed 2-4-69.)
901.06 WIDTHS.
   The width of sidewalks shall be determined as follows:
   (a)    No sidewalk shall be less than four feet wide.
   (b)    Where sidewalk repairs are made on existing sidewalks, the width
shall not be less than the existing walk.
   (c)    Where an existing walk is to be replaced with new construction, the
new walk shall be the same width as existing walks in the area but not less
than three and one-half feet wide.
   (d)    The City may require the owner to construct a sidewalk wider than
existing walks in the area where circumstances warrant.
   (e)    In areas where no sidewalks currently exist and application is made
for new construction, sidewalks shall not be less than four feet wide but the
City may require wider sidewalks where circumstances warrant.
      (Ord. 850305-19. Passed 4-16-85.)
901.07 THICKNESS.
   The thickness of nonreinforced Portland cement concrete walks shall be four
inches except across driveway approaches, where the thickness shall be six
inches.
(Ord. 690121-12. Passed 2-4-69.)
901.08 SUBBASE.
   Minimum subbase shall consist of four inches of gravel, crushed slag,
crushed stone, cinders or equivalent material.
(Ord. 690121-12. Passed 2-4-69.)
901.09 CONSTRUCTION METHODS.
   (a)    Sidewalks shall be constructed of class "C" Portland cement concrete
or equal.
   (b)    Methods of construction shall be those set forth in the current State
of Ohio Department of Highways Construction and Materials Specifications, Item
608.
(Ord. 690121. Passed 2-4-69.)
901.10 ADVERTISEMENT FOR BIDS.
   If the cost of constructing or repairing a sidewalk in front of any one
property shall exceed five thousand dollars ($5,000) Council shall advertise
for proposals for doing the work and furnishing materials therefore just as in
other cases of improvements to be taxed upon abutting property.
901.11 OBSTRUCTING SIDEWALKS PROHIBITED.
   (a)    No person shall obstruct any sidewalk of the City with any box,
barrel or any merchandise of any description.
   (b)   No person shall erect or permit to exist any awning posts, or frames
therefor, extending across any sidewalk of the City unless such items are seven
feet or more above the sidewalk. Materials must be approved by the State of
Ohio Building Department for structural integrity and design. No posts or
frames may be anchored into the sidewalk or curb. This ordinance is for
commercial buildings only.
(Ord. 220405-26. Passed 5-4-22.)
901.12 FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH NOTICE.
   (a)    No person shall fail or neglect, for thirty days after receiving
notice as provided in Sections
901.01 and
901.02, to construct or repair a sidewalk.
 
   (b)    In the event any person fails or neglects for thirty days after
receiving notice as provided in Sections
901.01 and
901.02, the Director of Public Service may have such construction or repair
done at the expense of the owner and all such expenses shall be assessed on all
the property bounding or abutting thereon. The assessments shall be collected
in the manner provided in Ohio R.C. 727.30 et seq. inclusive with a forfeiture
of ten percent (10%) and interest for failure to pay at the time fixed by the
assessing ordinance.
901.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a minor
misdemeanor. Each day on which a violation occurs or continues shall be deemed
a separate offense.
CHAPTER 905
Streets
905.01    Excavation permit required.
905.02   Deposit required prior to excavation; bond.
905.03   Application for excavation permit.
905.04   Refilling excavations.
905.05   Acceptance of streets and alleys for maintenance.
905.06   Acceptance of streets and alleys.
905.07   Obstruction of public ways prohibited.
905.08   Planters prohibited in streets.
905.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Assessments - see Ohio R.C. 701.05, Ch. 727
Power to establish and care for streets - see Ohio R.C. 715.19, 717.01, 723.01
Openings by the Municipality - see Ohio R.C. 723.02
Dedication and acceptance - see Ohio R.C. 723.03
Change of name, vacating and narrowing streets - see Ohio R.C. 723.04 et seq.
Sprinkling - see Ohio R.C. 723.16 et seq.
Surface treatment - see Ohio R.C. 723.23, 723.31
Excavation liability - see Ohio R.C. 723.49 et seq.
Changing established grade - see Ohio R.C. 727.07
Digging, excavating and piling earth on streets - see Ohio R.C. 5589.10
 
905.01 EXCAVATION PERMIT REQUIRED.
   No person shall take up or excavate in or under any street, alley or public
ground in the City without first obtaining a permit.
(1956 Code §301.05.)
905.02 DEPOSIT REQUIRED PRIOR TO EXCAVATION; BOND.
   (a)    The permit shall be granted by the Director of Public Service when
there has been deposited with him by the applicant a sum equal to double the
estimated cost of restoring the street to its proper condition. In no case less
than five dollars ($5.00) shall be deposited. The deposit shall be paid into
the street repair fund, to be held to secure the proper reconstruction and
repair of the work done under the permit. Permits may be issued for necessary
excavation in dirt roads and unpaved public grounds without requiring the
deposit of any sum, at the discretion of the Director. Permits may also be
issued without deposits under the provision of subsection (b) hereof.
   (b)    Any person may furnish a bond, approved by the Director both as to
amount and surety, conditioned upon faithful compliance with the conditions of
this section which shall pay on demand the cost and expense of refilling and
repaving all excavations taken up under permits issued to the person without
the cash deposit mentioned in subsection (a) hereof, during the life of the
bond. The bond may be revoked or additional sureties or an additional bond may
be required by the Director at any time.
(1956 Code §301.06, 301.07)
905.03 APPLICATION FOR EXCAVATION PERMIT.
   The Director of Public Service may decline to issue a permit, in which case
he shall refer the application to Council. Council may then grant or refuse it
on the usual terms, or may impose such conditions as to cash deposit or special
bond for the work proposed as the public interest may require.
(1956 Code §301.08)
905.04 REFILLING EXCAVATIONS.
   (a)    The work of refilling all excavations in paved streets and alleys and
repaving shall be done by the Director of Public Service. The actual cost of
the work and material under each permit shall be reported to the Director and a
statement thereof furnished by him to the person holding the permit. No other
payment shall be necessary. Every holder of a permit who has given bond may
replace the dirt filling under paved streets under the direction of the
Director. In that case the person holding the permit shall continue to be
liable to the City for any and all damages caused by imperfect filling or
tamping.
   (b)    All fees shall be paid to the Director. If cash deposit has been made
and there is a balance due the permit holder, the Director shall authorize the
proper warrant for the payment of the balance.
   (c)    The Director shall pay all moneys collected hereunder into the street
repair fund and shall report all collections and delinquencies to the City
Auditor.
   (d)    The Mayor shall issue permits and perform the duties herein imposed
on the Director during his absence or disability.
905.05 ACCEPTANCE OF STREETS AND ALLEYS FOR MAINTENANCE.
   No streets or alleys within any proposed plan of lots or additions to the
City shall be accepted for maintenance by the City unless the dedication of the
streets or alleys is accepted and confirmed by an ordinance specially passed
for such purpose or unless the Service Director has, upon special written
request by the owner of the land upon which the street or alley has been
constructed, checked the construction and found that such street or alley has
been constructed in accordance with City specifications and that such street or
alley is in good repair and has endorsed his finding on the approved plat of
such plan of lots or addition.
905.06 ACCEPTANCE OF STREETS AND ALLEYS.
   Any person, firm or corporation desiring to have a plan of lots or addition
to the City approved prior to the acceptance of the streets and alleys within
the plan of lots or addition shall conform to the following requirements:
   (a)    Dedicate the streets and alleys within the plan of lots or addition
to the City for public use.
   (b)    Enter into a contract with the City whereby the person, firm or
corporation shall agree to bring the streets and alleys to comply with City
specifications. The time in which the work is to be completed shall be fixed by
Council.
   (c)    If Council so desires, post a bond conditioned and guaranteeing that
the work shall be done according to the terms of the contract. The amount of
the bond shall be fixed by Council.
   (d)    When any person, firm or corporation has complied with the
requirements of this section, Council may approve the plan of lots or addition
to the City by motion. Such approval shall in no way be deemed an acceptance of
the streets and alleys within the plan of lots or addition for maintenance.
905.07 OBSTRUCTION OF PUBLIC WAYS PROHIBITED.
   No person shall place, or cause any wood, coal, bricks, lumber or other
object to be placed upon any street, sidewalk or alley or on any other public
ground in the City other than materials with which to make or repair such
street, alley or sidewalk. However, any person intending to build a new
building or repair one already built, or to make other improvements, or to
place containers for the depositing of waste paper, planters for the
beautification of the City, or other objects for the public good shall procure
a written permit from the Mayor, or in his absence, from the Service Director.
The permit shall protect him from any fine for depositing any timber, or other
material intended for a building or other improvements, or other objects for
the space of time specified.
(Ord. 730712-73. Passed 7-12-73.)
905.08 PLANTERS PROHIBITED IN STREETS.
   (a)    There shall be no planters constructed within the City on any street
that encroach or intrude into the traveled portion of any street or roadway.
   (b)    The Service Director shall be directed to remove or rescind any
authority previously granted to SCURC to construct any planter in the street.
(Ord. 880719-73. Passed 7-14-88.)
905.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a minor
misdemeanor. Each day on which a violation occurs or continues shall be deemed
a separate offense.
CHAPTER 909
Weeds
909.01   Cutting required.
909.02   Failure to comply.
909.03   Notice of violation.
909.04   Cost to be a lien upon the property.
909.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate shade trees and shrubbery - see Ohio R.C. 715.20
Assessments for tree planting or maintenance - see Ohio R.C. 727.011
Notice to cut noxious weeds - see Ohio R.C. 731.51 et seq.
Destruction of weeds - see Ohio R.C. 971.33 et seq.
Injury or destruction - see GEN. OFF.
541.06
Noxious weeds - see OAC Ch. 901:5-31
909.01 CUTTING REQUIRED.
   No property owner shall refuse or neglect to cut weeds or grass when such
weeds or grass have reached a height in excess of eight inches.
(Ord. 240730-57. Passed 7-30-24.)
909.02 FAILURE TO COMPLY.
   Every owner of real estate within the City shall cut any weeds or grass on
his property, including the curb lawn, at all such times as may be necessary so
that such weeds or grass shall not exceed eight inches in height, and if such
owner neglects or refuses to cut weeds so that such weeds or grass shall exceed
eight inches in height, the City may cut the weeds or grass or authorize some
person to cut the weeds or grass on behalf of the City.
(Ord. 240730-57. Passed 7-30-24.)
909.03 NOTICE OF VIOLATION.
   (a)    The Zoning Officer/Agent, Director of Housing, Housing Inspector(s),
or their designee shall notify in writing any property owner on whose property
weeds or grass have grown to a height in excess of eight (8) inches that he is
required to cut such weeds or grass.
   (b)    Such notice shall be deemed to be properly served upon such owner or
agent, or upon such occupant, if a copy thereof is served upon him or her
personally; or if a copy thereof is sent by certified mail, return receipt
requested to his or her last known address. If the certified mail is returned
unclaimed or refused, then regular mail service with certificate of mailing
shall constitute proper service; or if a copy thereof is posted in a
conspicuous place in or about the dwelling affected by the notice and a copy is
sent by regular U.S. mail to the owner's last known address with certificate of
mailing indicating that it was sent. Such notice of violation shall be served
upon the owner or his agent, or the occupant as the case may require. If the
owner, agent, or tenant is present during the inspection, then a copy may be
mailed by regular mail to the owner's last known address with certificate of
mailing. If any mail is returned as undeliverable, then the City shall use one
of the alternate methods of service as described above.
   (c)    If such property owner refuses or fails to cut such weeds or grass
within five days after receiving such notice, then the Zoning Officer/Agent,
Director of Housing, Housing Inspector(s), or their designee shall cause the
weeds or grass to be cut. The owner of such property shall thereupon be
indebted for the expense incurred a of one hundred dollars ($100.00), or as set
in the established Citywide Fee Schedule and whatever the contract mowing
company charges the City to mow, trim and clean up clippings. After the initial
mowing, the City will continue to maintain the property as needed and owner
will be invoiced each time, and shall pay the cost thereof within five days
after being notified of such costs by the Zoning Officer/Agent, Director of
Housing, Housing Inspector(s), or their designee .
(Ord. 240730-57. Passed 7-30-24.)
909.04 COST TO BE A LIEN UPON THE PROPERTY.
   In the event the owner or occupant fails to pay the cost incurred in the
cutting of weeds or grass as provided for in Section
909.03  within five (5) days after being notified of such cost by the Zoning
Officer/Agent, Director of Housing, Housing Inspector(s), or their designee it
becomes necessary to certify the expenses incurred by the City to the Auditor
of Columbiana County and to place them in the counter book of the Auditor of
Columbiana County as a special assessment on the property. If not paid by
September 1st, the mowing cost will be certified to the County Auditor's Office
as a special assessment and an additional twenty dollars ($20.00) filing fee,
or such fee set in the Citywide Fee Schedule shall be assessed to defray the
cost of certification.
(Ord. 240730-57. Passed 7-30-24.)
909.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor of
the fourth degree. Each day's violation shall constitute a separate offense. If
the offender has previously been convicted of a similar charge under this
chapter within the past year, the violation shall be a misdemeanor of the third
degree.
(Ord. 240730-57. Passed 7-30-24.)
CHAPTER 913

CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate shade trees and shrubbery - see Ohio R.C. 715.20
Assessments for tree planting or maintenance - see Ohio R.C. 727.011
Injury or destruction of trees - see GEN. OFF.
541.06
 
913.01 DEFINITIONS.
   For the purpose of this chapter the following terms, phrases, words, and
their derivations shall have the meaning given herein. When not inconsistent
with the context, words used in the present tense include the future, words in
the plural include the singular, and words in the singular include the plural.
The word shall is mandatory and not merely directory.
   (a)    "City" means the incorporated City of Salem, Ohio.
   (b)    "Person" means any person, firm, partnership, association,
corporation, company or organization of any kind.
   (c)    "Street or highway" means the entire width of every public way or
right of way when any part thereof is open to the use of the public, as a
matter of right, for purposes of vehicular and pedestrian traffic.
   (d)    "Park" includes all public parks.
   (e)    "Public places" includes all other grounds owned by the City.
   (f)    "Property line" means the legal boundary line.
   (g)    "Lawn strip or curb strip" means that part of a street or highway
right of way outside of the portion improved for travel, including the
sidewalk.
   (h)    "Public trees" includes all shade and ornamental trees, now or
hereafter growing on any street, including lawn strip, or on any other public
lands.
   (i)    "Large trees" are designated as those attaining a height of forty-
five feet or more.
   (j)    "Medium trees" are designated as those attaining a height of thirty
to forty-five feet.
   (k)    "Small trees" are designated as those attaining a height of twenty to
thirty feet.
   (l)    "Property owner" means the person owning such property as shown by
the County Auditor's Plat of Columbiana County
   (m)    "Shade or ornamental tree or shrub" means any and all woody
vegetation.
   (n)    "Dripline" means the approximately circular vertical extension to the
ground of the outer most branches and leaves of the tree as an indication of
the spread of the root system.
(Ord. 830215-9. Passed 3-15-83)
   (o)    "Tree removal" means the removal of all above ground parts, including
the stump and roots.
(Ord. 830719-50. Passed 7-19-83.)
913.02 SHADE TREE COMMISSION ESTABLISHED.
   (a)   Members. There shall be created a Commission to be known and
designated as the Shade Tree Commission composed of seven residents of the
City. Five of such members shall be appointed by the Mayor with approval of
Council. The sixth member shall be a member of Council and the seventh member
shall be the Mayor.
   (b)   Term. The term of the five persons of the Shade Tree Commission to be
appointed by the Mayor shall be three years, except the term of the members
appointed to the first Commission shall be as follows: One member for three
years, two members for two years, and two members for one year. In the event
that a vacancy shall occur during the term of any member, his/her successor
shall be appointed for the unexpired portion of the term.
   (c)   Compensation. Members of the Shade Tree Commission shall serve without
compensation but shall be entitled to reimbursement for any and all necessary
expenditures in carrying out the function of the Commission.
   (d)   Duties. The duties of the Shade Tree Commission shall be as follows:
      (1)    To study the problems and determine the needs of the City in
connection with its tree planting program.
      (2)    To recommend to the proper authority, the type and kind of trees
to be planted upon such City streets or parts of the City streets or in parks
as is designated.
      (3)    To assist the properly constituted City officials as well as
Council and residents in the dissemination of news and information regarding
the selection, planting and maintenance of trees within the corporate limits or
on public property, and to make such recommendations from time to time to
Council as to desirable legislation concerning the tree program and activities
for the Municipality.
      (4)    To provide regular and special meetings at which the subject of
trees insofar as it relates to the Municipality may be discussed by the members
of the Commission, officers and personnel of the City and its several
divisions, and all others interested in the tree program.
   (e)   Meetings. Within a reasonable time after the appointment of such
Commission and the approval of the members thereof, upon call of the mayor, the
Commission shall meet and organize by the election of a chairman and
appointment of a secretary. The holding of regular and special meetings shall
occur as such Commission deems advisable and necessary in order to perform the
duties set forth herein.
(Ord. 040601-37. Passed 6-1-04.)
913.03 AUTHORITY OF THE SHADE TREE COMMISSION.
   (a)    Rules and Regulations. The Shade Tree Commission shall have the
authority to promulgate the rules and regulations of the Arboricultural
Specifications and Standards of Practice governing the planting, fertilization,
pruning and bracing of trees on the streets or other public sites in the City,
and shall direct, regulate and control the planting, of all trees growing now
or hereafter in any public area of the City. The Commission shall cause the
provisions of this Chapter to be enforced.
   (b)   Jurisdiction. The Commission shall have the authority and jurisdiction
of regulating the planting, of trees on streets and other publicly owned
property to insure safety or preserve the aesthetics of such public sites, in
accordance with the permit system contained in the terms of this Chapter.
   (c)   Supervision. The Commission shall have the authority and it shall be
their duty to supervise or inspect all work done under a permit issued in
accordance with the terms of this Chapter.
   (d)   Condition of Permit. The Commission shall have the authority to affix
reasonable conditions to the granting of the permit in accordance with the
terms of this Chapter.
   (e)    Master Street Tree Plan. The Commission shall have the authority to
formulate a Master Street Tree Plan. The Plan shall specify the species of tree
to be planted on each of the streets or other public sites of the Municipality.
From and after the effective date of the Plan, or any amendment thereof, all
planting shall conform thereto.
      (1)    The Commission shall consider all existing and future utility and
environmental factors when recommending a specific species for each of the
streets and other public sites of the City.
      (2)    The Commission shall have the authority to amend or add to the
Master Street Tree Plan at any time that circumstances make it advisable.
         (Ord. 040601-37. Passed 6-1-04.)
913.04 PERMITS REQUIRED.
   (a)    Planting, Maintenance or Removal.  
      (1)    No person shall plant, spray, fertilize, preserve, prune, remove,
cut above ground or otherwise disturb any tree on any street or City owned
property without first filing an application and procuring a permit from a
specified Municipal authority. The person receiving the permit shall abide by
the Arboricultural Specifications and Standards of Practice adopted by the
Shade Tree Commission.
      (2)    Application for permits must be made at the office of the Mayor’s
secretary.
      (3)    The Shade Tree Commission shall issue the permit for planting
trees in the curb lawn, and maintaining trees as contemplated in Section (c)
below.
      (4)    The Director of Public Service shall have sole discretion to
permit the removal of curb lawn trees.
      (5)    The Director of Public Service, or his agent, shall remove, in
whole or in part, dangerous and/or dead curb lawn trees.
   (b)    Planting.
      (1)    Application Data. The application required herein shall state the
number of trees to be set out; the location, grade, species, cultivar or
variety of each tree; the method of planting; and such other information as the
Commission shall find reasonably necessary to a fair determination of whether a
permit should be issued.
      (2)    Improper Planting. Whenever any tree is planted or set out in
conflict with the provisions of this Section, it shall be lawful for the
Commission to remove or cause removal of the same, and the exact cost thereof
shall be assessed to the owner as provided by law in the case of special
assessments.
   (c)   Maintenance. The application required herein shall state the number
and kinds of trees to be sprayed, fertilized, pruned, or otherwise preserved;
the kind of treatment to be administered; the composition of the spray material
to be applied; and such other information as the Commission finds reasonably
necessary for a fair determination of whether a permit should be issued.
   (d)    Removal, Replanting and Replacement.  
      (1)    Wherever it is necessary to remove a tree or trees from a lawn
strip in connection with the paving of a sidewalk, or the paving or widening of
the portion of a street or highway used for vehicular traffic the Director of
Public Service shall have the authority to remove said tree or trees. Any
property owner wanting to replace trees must contact the Shade Tree Commission.
      (2)    No person or property owner shall remove a tree from the lawn
strip for the purpose of construction without the approval of the Director of
Public Service. The person or property owner shall bear the cost of removal and
replacement of all trees removed.
         (Ord. 040601-37. Passed 6-1-04.)
913.05 OBSTRUCTIONS; PRUNING.
   It shall be the duty of any person or persons owning or occupying the real
property bordering on any street upon which property there may be trees, to
prune such trees in such manner that they will not obstruct or shade the street
lights, obstruct the passage of pedestrians on sidewalks, obstruct vision of
traffic signs, or obstruct the view of any street or alley intersection. The
minimum clearance of any overhanging portion thereof shall be ten feet over
sidewalks, and twelve feet over all streets except truck thoroughfares which
shall have a clearance of sixteen feet.
   (a)    Notice to Prune. Should any person or persons owning real property
bordering on any street fail to prune trees as herein above provided, the Shade
Tree Commission shall order such person or persons, within three days after
receipt of written notice to so prune such trees.
   (b)    Failure to Comply. When a person to whom an order is directed shall
fail to comply within the specified time, it shall be lawful for the
Municipality to prune such trees and the exact cost thereof shall be assessed
to the owner as provided by law in the case of special assessments.
(Ord. 830215-9. Passed 3-15-83.)
913.06 ABUSE OR MUTILATION OF PUBLIC TREES.
   Unless specifically authorized by the Director of Public Service, no person
shall intentionally damage, cut, carve, transplant or remove any tree; attach
any rope, wire, nails, advertising posters or other contrivance to any tree,
allow any gaseous liquid or solid substance which is harmful to such trees to
come in contact with them; or set fire or permit any fire to burn when such
fire or the heat thereof will injure any portion of any tree.
(Ord. 040601-37. Passed 6-1-04.)
913.07 INTERFERENCE.
   No person shall hinder, prevent, delay or interfere with the Director of
Public Service or the Shade Tree Commission while engaged in carrying out the
execution or enforcement of this Chapter; provided, however, that nothing
herein shall be construed as an attempt to prohibit the pursuit of any remedy,
legal or equitable, in any court of competent jurisdiction for the protection
of property rights by the owner of any property within the Municipality.
(Ord. 040601-37. Passed 6-1-04.)
913.08 PROTECTION OF TREES.
   (a)   All trees on any street or other publicly owned property near any
excavation or construction of any building, structure or street work, shall be
guarded with a good, substantial fence, frame or box not less than four feet
high and eight feet square, or at a distance in feet from the tree equal to the
diameter of the trunk in inches D.B.H., whichever is greater, and all building
material, dirt or other debris shall be kept outside the barrier.
   (b)    No person shall excavate any ditches, tunnels, trenches or lay any
drive within a radius of ten feet from any public tree without first obtaining
permission from the Director of Public Service.
(Ord. 040601-37. Passed 6-1-04.)
913.09 PLACING MATERIALS ON PUBLIC PROPERTY.
   No person shall deposit, place, store or maintain upon any public place of
the City, any stone, brick, sand, concrete or other materials which may impede
the free passage of water, air and fertilizer to the roots of any tree growing
therein, except by written permit of the Shade Tree Commission.
(Ord. 830215-9. Passed 3-15-83.)
913.10 STREET TREE PLAN FOR NEW DEVELOPMENTS.
   Any new street developed in a subdivision by a private developer and
dedicated to the City shall have a street tree plan approved by the Committee
and a bond posted, amount determined by the Shade Tree Commission with
Council's approval, for future installation of the plan. This requirement would
be added to the list of subdivision regulations.
(Ord. 830215-9. Passed 3-15-83.)
913.99 PENALTY.
   Any person, firm or corporation violating or failing to comply with any of
the provisions of this chapter shall be guilty of a minor misdemeanor.

according to Salem Utilities Department regulations. The Salem Utilities

to the Salem Utilities Department’s schedule or the user with no water meter
installed may continue to pay for a flat sewer use rate based upon 800 cubic
feet per month use**.

921.04 SEWER RATES AND CHARGES.
   (a)   Sewer rates and charges shall be those rates and charges currently
approved by Council.
   (b)   The rate for sewer service use for premises outside the City limits,
shall be an additional fifty percent (50%) more than the rates charged for
sewer service use inside the City limits unless otherwise provided for in any
agreement or subsequent agreement entered into by the City for premises outside
the corporate limits.
   (c)   Failure to make any payments will be subject to the charges as
indicated in the Water Use By-Laws and Regulations of the City of Salem Water
Section of the Utilities Department.
   (d)   In the event that it can be shown to the satisfaction of the
Superintendent of Utilities with respect to any premises that a portion of the
water from any source consumed on any such premises does not and cannot in the
future enter into the Salem Waste Water Collection System; then, in each such
case, at the owner’s request and expense, such owner shall install a separate
water metering device in accordance to the type and installation as approved by
the Salem Utilities Department and install and maintain an Ohio Environmental
Protection Agency (OEPA) approved Double Check Backflow Preventer or Reduced
Pressure Double Check Backflow Preventer of the type and installation as
approved by the Salem Utilities Department. Such water used on the premises,
but does not and cannot enter the Salem Waste Water Collection System shall not
be subject to waste water users charges and shall be considered a separate
billing account.
(Ord. 920616-73. Passed 7-14-92.)
921.05 SUPPLEMENTAL CHARGES.
   All users of the Salem Sewage System outside the Salem corporation limits
shall pay fifty percent (50%) more per hundred cubic feet than the amount
charged residents inside the Salem corporation limits.
(Ord. 1610118-57. Passed 11-1-16.)
921.06 DISCHARGE OF WASTES REGULATED.
   (See Wastewater Rules and Regulations as adopted under Ordinance No. 861105-
94 and Ordinance No. 931103-127, passed February 15, 1994.)
921.07 CONSTRUCTION OF SEWER LINES.
   (a)   Plans. Any person intending to install trunk line and interceptor
sewers, which are to be a part of or connected with the City sewer system,
shall submit to the Service Director, for his approval, plans governing the
proposed design. Such plans shall indicate for the purpose of analysis the
following:
      (1)   Area of lands to be served, in acres.
      (2)   Estimated number of persons per acre.
      (3)   Area of land which possibly may be connected to the proposed system
in the future, in acres.
      (4)   Gallons per day average flow, based on one hundred gallons per day
per person.
      (5)   Gallons per day of permitted industrial flow, if any.
      (6)   Infiltration allowance.
      (7)   Total flow.
      (8)   Future increase estimated.
      (9)   Total future average daily flow.
      (10)   Maximum daily future flow.
      (11)   Slope of sewer.
      (12)   Pipe sizes.
      (13)   Percentage depth of flow.
      (14)   The velocity of such sewers flowing one-half full shall not be
less than two feet per second to prevent settling out of solids, nor more than
eight feet per second, unless special conditions warrant.
      (15)   The trench loading on the sewer and the strength of pipe and type
of installation to be followed to adequately support the calculated trench
load.
   (b)   Structural Requirements. Any person installing trunk lines or
interceptor sewers, which are to be a part of or connected with the City sewer
system, shall install such sewers according to specifications set forth in this
section, and in accordance with the following rules and regulations:
      (1)   Lines and grades.
         A.   Grade stakes shall be set not more than fifty feet apart and
shall establish both lines and grade.
         B.   Batter boards shall be used to carry a grade string.
         C.   A grade rod shall be used to establish the grade of the trench
and to set each pipe.
      (2)   Supplementary foundations.
         A.   If the bottom of the trench is not sufficiently stable or firm to
prevent vertical or lateral displacement of the pipe after installation,
supplementary foundation shall be used irrespective of loading requirements.
         B.   The type of supplementary foundation to be used shall be sand and
gravel to stabilize the trench bottom or concrete, cradle, timber or masonry
bridging supported upon a pile foundation, as determined by the Municipal
engineering representative.
         C.    Pipe laid in rock trenches shall be supported on a supplementary
foundation of at least four inches of clay cushion or sand and gravel cushion
to support the bottom quadrant.
      (3)    Tamping.
         A.    Tamping to prevent lateral displacement of the pipe shall be
accomplished by tamping coarse graded backfill in successive layers of not more
than six inches each, to a depth of at least eighteen inches above the pipe.
The remainder of the backfill shall be reasonably uniform, free from large
stones and chunks of frozen material.
         B.    Where pavement is to be placed or replaced over the trench, the
compaction of the backfill shall be in accordance with State highway
specifications for soil compaction requirements.
      (4)    Manholes.
         A.    The manholes shall have a minimum bottom diameter of four feet
inside and provide for a two-foot clear opening through a cast iron frame and
cover at the top. The top elevation shall be that of the existing or proposed
finished street grade.
         B.    Materials of construction shall be eight-inch concrete base at
least six inches larger than the outside diameter of the manhole as measured at
the flow line.
         C.    The walls shall be either brick or precast concrete.
         D.    Brick walls shall not be less than eight inches thick, and
thicker walls shall be required where, in the opinion of the City, heavier wall
construction is necessary.
         E.    Precast concrete manholes shall be Salem City Standard or equal,
subject to approval of the City before installation.
         F.    A minimum of three-eighths inch plaster coat shall be placed
inside and outside the brick masonry walls.
      (5)    Storm water.
         A.    Storm water runoff shall not be permitted in sanitary sewers
either during or after construction.
         B.    During construction the contractor or others shall use every
precaution in blocking the entrance of storm water into sanitary sewers at all
times with suitable expansion plugs or heavy sand bags.
   (c)    Inspections. Any person constructing a sewer which is to be connected
to the sewer system of the City shall have an inspector at the site of the work
during the entire construction period. Such inspector shall be furnished by the
City and shall be available as nearly as possible during the entire working
period. The cost of such inspector furnished shall be paid by the person
installing the sewer system at the prevailing rate of pay received by the
inspector.
   (d)    Retainer Fee. The person shall deposit with the City a retainer fee
prior to the start of the work of sixteen cents (16¢) per foot of pipe as
indicated on the plans. Such retainer fee shall be used to defray the cost of
the inspector but shall not relieve the above persons from paying the entire
inspection cost should it exceed the retainer fee.
   (e)   Liability of Installers. The person installing such sewer system shall
save harmless the City and its authorized agents or representatives for all
damages to persons or property, public or private, and shall be liable for all
maintenance of sewers, due to faulty construction or materials, for a period of
twelve months after formal acceptance of the sewer by the City authority.
(Ord. 880216-14. Passed 3-15-88.)
921.08 COLLECTION OF CHARGES.
   (a)   Sewer bills shall be paid at the same time and in the same manner as
water bills.
   (b)   Delinquent water and sewer accounts shall be certified to the City
Auditor in August of each year. The City Auditor shall certify accounts to the
County Auditor for placement against the property of a special tax assessment
by the second Tuesday in September.
(Ord. 880216-14. Passed 3-15-88.)
921.09 STORM SEWERS.
   Storm water and all other unpolluted drainage shall be discharged to such
sewers as are specifically designated as combined sewers or storm sewers, or to
a natural outlet approved by the Service Director.
(Ord. 880216-14. Passed 3-15-88.)
921.10 PROCEDURE FOR SANITARY SEWER SERVICE CONNECTION OR EXTENSION.
   (a)    Application.  Application for sanitary sewer connection, or extension
of the Salem Sanitary Sewer System shall be made to the Superintendent of
Utilities or designee of the Superintendent of Utilities. The application shall
contain: (1) description of the land to be served, (2) building site
description, (3) service requirements, (4) copy of deed to the property, and
(5) such other information as the Superintendent of Utilities or designee of
the Superintendent of Utilities may require from time to time.
   (b)    Sewer Tap-In.
      (1)   The Superintendent of Utilities or designee of the Superintendent
of Utilities is delegated the authority to grant or deny sewer service tap-ins
from the existing or future sanitary sewer collection systems within the City
of Salem and from the approved existing or future sanitary sewers outside the
City of Salem.
      
   (c)    Extensions.
      (1)   Within City Limits. The Superintendent of Utilities or designee of
the Superintendent of Utilities is delegated authority to grant or deny
extension of sanitary sewers within the City of Salem.
      (2)   Outside City Limits. The Superintendent of Utilities or designee of
the Superintendent of Utilities shall refer to the Utilities Committee of
Council any application for sanitary sewer system extensions outside the
corporate limits of the City of Salem. Approval of such application must be by
concurrence of the Superintendent of Utilities or designee of the
Superintendent of Utilities and the Utilities Committee of Council, and upon
Resolution of Council.
      (3)    Design Requirements. Plans for a proposed sanitary sewer extension
shall be prepared by a registered certified engineer, in accordance with the
specifications and approval of the Superintendent of Utilities or designee of
the Superintendent of Utilities and the Ohio Environmental Protection Agency.
   (d)    Annexation to the City of Salem Required.
      (1)   Property owners who are requesting sanitary sewer services from the
City of Salem whose property is in whole or in part outside the City limits yet
contiguous to the City of Salem shall first annex into the City of Salem before
receiving a sanitary sewer service tap-in.
      (2)   Property owners whose property is exclusively outside the limits of
the City of Salem, but whose property is contiguous to an existing City sewer
main or any such City sewer main constructed in the future, may make
application for sanitary sewer service with the Salem Utilities Department and
if application is approved, said property owner shall provide a deed
restriction agreeing to annex into the City of Salem at such time as the
property being served becomes contiguous to the City limits. The deed
restriction shall be in the exact form provided by the Salem Utilities
Department. Upon approval of the deed restriction by the Salem Utilities
Department, the property owner shall have said restriction recorded on the
property owner's deed at the respective County Recorder's Office with
jurisdiction over said property and a copy of the recording of the deed
restriction shall be delivered to the Salem Utilities Department together with
the payment of any appropriate fees before the sewer service tap-in is made.
The property owner shall be required to begin the process of annexation to the
City of Salem within ninety (90) days of said property becoming contiguous to
the City and shall be required to cooperate and participate with the City or
other adjacent or contiguous property owners by signing an application for
annexation pursuant to any mass or multiple property annexation which can or
should result in said owner's property becoming contiguous to the City of
Salem.
   (e)    Monthly Report. The Utilities Superintendent or designee of the
Superintendent of Utilities shall provide to Council and the Salem Utilities
Commission a monthly report of all sanitary sewer connections and extensions
requested and granted (including the names of property owners, location, action
taken and the Superintendent's comments).
   (f)    Moratorium.  The Superintendent of Utilities or designee of the
Superintendent of Utilities may issue a moratorium on sanitary sewer service
connections when the Superintendent of Utilities or designee of the
Superintendent of Utilities determines that the safe operating capacity or the
integrity of any segment of the City Sanitary Sewer System has been reached or
exceeded. (Ord. 140520-32. Passed 5-20-14.)
921.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter where a penalty has not been
specifically provided for shall be guilty of a minor misdemeanor. Each day on
which a violation occurs or continues shall be a separate offense.
(Ord. 880216-14. Passed 3-15-88.)

   (c)   All bills shall be due fifteen (15) days after the issue date of the
bill.
   (d)   Bills paid after the due date shall be subject to a ten percent (10%)
penalty.
(Ord. 220104-04. Passed 1-4-22.)
925.05 SUPPLEMENTAL CHARGES.
   All users of the Salem Water System outside the Salem corporation limits
shall pay fifty percent (50%) more than the amount charged residents inside the
Salem corporation limits.
(Ord. 220104-04. Passed 1-4-22.)
925.06 TAMPERING WITH HYDRANT, PIPE OR METER.
   (a)   No person shall maliciously open, close, adjust, or interfere with a
fire hydrant, valve, regulator, gauge, gate, disc, curb cock, stopcock, meter
or other regulator, operating or measuring device, or appliance in or attached
to the wells, tanks, reservoirs, conduits, pipes, mains, service pipes, house
pipes, or other pipes or apparatus of a water company or furnisher of water,
with intent to cause the escape of water or to injure or destroy such property.
No person shall tap, sever, open or make unauthorized connection with a main or
pipe used or intended for the transmission of water. This section does not
apply to the agent or employee for that purpose, of the owner or operator of
the appliances referred to in this section, and does not apply to anything done
by or under authority of any regularly constituted Fire Department.
   (b)   Whoever violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor of the fourth
degree.
(Ord. 840619-38. Passed 7-17-84.)
925.07 PROCEDURE FOR WATER SERVICE CONNECTION OR EXTENSION.
   (a)    Application.  Application for water tap-in or extension of the Salem
Water System shall be made to the Superintendent of Utilities or designee of
the Superintendent of Utilities. The application shall contain: (1) description
of the land to be served, (2) building site description, (3) service
requirements, (4) copy of the deed to the property, and (5) such other
information as the Superintendent of Utilities or designee of the
Superintendent of Utilities may require from time to time.
   (b)    Water Tap-In.
      (1)   The Superintendent of Utilities or designee of the Superintendent
of Utilities is delegated the authority to grant or deny water tap-ins from the
existing or future water main systems within the City of Salem and from the
existing or future water mains outside the City of Salem with the exception of
the Salem-Elkton Water Main as outlined below.
      (2)   Elkton Federal Prison Water Main. Water main tap-ins to any
property or corporation from the water main known as the Elkton Federal Prison
Water Main shall fall within the authority of the Salem Utilities Commission
pursuant to prior Ordinance 070717-47 granting them such authority.
   (c)    Water Main Extensions.
      (1)   Within City Limits. The Superintendent of Utilities or designee of
the Superintendent of Utilities is delegated authority to grant or deny
extension of water mains within the City of Salem.
      (2)   Outside City Limits. The Superintendent of Utilities or designee of
the Superintendent of Utilities shall refer to the Utilities Committee of
Council for any application for water main system extensions outside the
corporate limits of the City of Salem. Approval of such application must be by
concurrence of the Superintendent of Utilities or designee of the
Superintendent of Utilities and the Utilities Committee of Council, and upon
Resolution of Council.
      (3)   Design Requirements. Plans for a proposed water main extension
shall be prepared by a registered certified engineer in accordance with the
specifications and approval of the Salem Utilities Department and the Ohio
Environmental Protection Agency.
   (d)    Annexation to the City of Salem Required.
      (1)   Property owners who are requesting water services from the City of
Salem whose property is in whole or in part outside the City limits yet
contiguous to the City of Salem shall first annex into the City of Salem before
receiving a water service tap-in.
      (2)   Property owners whose property is exclusively outside the limits of
the City of Salem, but whose property is contiguous to an existing City water
main or any such City water main constructed in the future, may make
application for water service with the Salem Utilities Department and if
application is approved, said property owner shall provide a deed restriction
agreeing to annex into the City of Salem at such time as the property being
served becomes contiguous to the City limits. The deed restriction shall be in
the exact form provided by the Salem Utilities Department. Upon approval of the
deed restriction by the Salem Utilities Department, the property owner shall
have said restriction recorded on the property owner's deed at the respective
County Recorder's Office with jurisdiction over said property and a copy of the
recording of the deed restriction shall be delivered to the Salem Utilities
Department together with the payment of any appropriate fees before the water
service tap-in is made. The property owner shall be required to begin the
process of annexation to the City of Salem within ninety (90) days of said
property becoming contiguous to the City and shall be required to cooperate and
participate with the City or other adjacent or contiguous property owners by
signing an application for annexation pursuant to any mass or multiple property
annexation which can or should result in said owner's property becoming
contiguous to the City of Salem.
   (e)    Monthly Report. The Utilities Superintendent or designee of the
Superintendent of Utilities shall provide to Council and the Salem Utilities
Commission a monthly report of all water connections and extensions requested
and granted (including the names of property owners, location, action taken and
any comments of the Superintendent of Utilities or designee of the
Superintendent of Utilities ).
   (f)    Moratorium. The Superintendent of Utilities or designee of the
Superintendent of Utilities may issue a moratorium on water service connections
when the Superintendent of Utilities or designee of the Superintendent of
Utilities determines that the safe operating capacity or the integrity of any
segment of the City Water System has been reached or exceeded. (Ord. 140520-
32. Passed 5-20-14.)

Cemeteries

951.99    Penalty.

951.01 INTERMENT.
   No interment of the dead shall be made within the City limits. However,
nothing in this chapter shall prohibit the interment of the dead in the
cemetery on North Lincoln Avenue, known as Hope Cemetery; or in the tract or
parcel of land described as follows: Start at a point on the west line of North
Lincoln Avenue, which point is the northeast corner of Hope Cemetery as now
bounded and known, from this given point run thence northeasterly along the
west line of North Lincoln Avenue 300 feet; thence west and parallel with the
north boundary line of Hope Cemetery 1,075 feet to the west line of land now
owned by Estate of Elizabeth P. Heaton, deceased; thence south 250 feet to a
point on the north boundary line of Hope Cemetery 1,025 feet, but to the west
line of North Lincoln Avenue, and being the point of beginning, containing
about 5.7 acres of land; or in the cemetery on South Ellsworth Street, known as
the "Friends Burying Grounds".
(1956 Code §371 01.)
951.99 PENALTY.
   (a)    Any person violating the provisions of this chapter is guilty of a
minor misdemeanor. Each day on which a violation occurs or continues shall be
deemed a separate offense.
 
   (b)    Council is empowered to cause any body interred contrary to the
provisions of this chapter to be taken up and buried outside the City limits.
 
 
 
CHAPTER 953
Indigent Burials
953.01   Indigent burial program established.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Cemeteries - see S.U. & P.S. Ch.
951
 
953.01 INDIGENT BURIAL PROGRAM ESTABLISHED.
   (a)   When the body of a deceased person is found within the City limits of
the municipal corporation and such person was not an inmate of a penal,
reformation, benevolent or charitable institution of the State and such body is
not claimed by any person for private interment or cremation at such person’s
expense or delivered for the purpose of medical and surgical study or
dissection in accordance with Ohio R.C. 1713.34, or whenever a claim is made
that the City is liable for the interment, cremation or burial expense of any
deceased person, the Director of Public Service shall determine if such person
is an unclaimed or an indigent person based upon the investigation of any
governmental entity or administration, or the combination of any governmental
agency or administration and any private party or enterprise and thereafter
shall either reject such claim or refer such claim to the City Auditor pursuant
to the City’s obligations under the provisions of Ohio R.C. 5113.15.
   (b)   In the event the Service Director finds that the City is obligated
under the provisions of Ohio R.C. 5113.15 to bury or cremate such decedent at
the expense of the City he shall certify his findings to the City Auditor. The
Auditor is hereby authorized to pay not more than five hundred dollars
($500.00) for all services rendered by a funeral director or other party to
bury or cremate such deceased person in accordance with the rules and
regulations established by the Service Director and in accordance with the
following schedule:
      $500.00 for each adult person
      $300.00 for each child under twelve years of age
      $200.00 for a still birth funeral
   (c)   In the event any person legally authorized to do so requests that the
body of any such decedent be buried by a particular funeral director,
crematorium or buried in a particular cemetery not operated and maintained by
and under the jurisdiction of the City, the Auditor may pay a total amount for
services rendered by such funeral director or other party or by such cemetery
or crematorium in conjunction with the preparation for and burial of such body
not to exceed the fee schedule as specified in subsection (b) hereof with such
expenses including but not limited to the furnishing of a casket, wood box,
burial container, cremation and marker.
   (d)   In the event that any such deceased person as contemplated in this
section is found to have assets, insurance or other benefits or allowances
available for the payment of all or part of the expenses as contemplated
herein, the City shall deduct that amount from the fee schedule as enumerated
in subsection (b).
   (e)   In the event it is determined after the burial or cremation of any
deceased person, and the payment of such expenses by the City, that such
decedent had means, assets, insurance or other benefits or allowances available
for the payment of all or part of such expenses including the cost of the lot
and charges normally made for the services rendered in such burial, such
proceedings shall be taken to recover such portion of the costs and expenses as
may be authorized by law.
   (f)   The Municipality shall provide, at the grave of the person, or if the
person’s cremated remains are buried, at the grave of the person’s cremated
remains, a stone or concrete marker on which the person’s name and age, if
known, and the date of death shall be inscribed.
(Ord. 020115. Passed 1-15-02.)
CHAPTER 955
Parks
955.01   Compliance required.
955.02   Trucks on park streets prohibited.
955.03   Hours.
955.04   Prohibited conduct.
955.05   Activities requiring written permission.
955.06   Speed limits.
955.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Land appropriation for parks - see Ohio R.C. 715. 21, 719.01
Board of Park Commissioners - see Ohio R.C. 755.01 et seq.
Playgrounds - see Ohio R.C. 755.14 et seq.
Board of Park Trustees - see Ohio R.C. 755.19 et seq.
Power to regulate vehicle speed in parks - see Ohio R.C. 4511 07(E)
 
955.01 COMPLIANCE REQUIRED.
   The Salem parks are for the benefit of its citizens, and surrounding
communities, and all these citizens shall be permitted to use the parks subject
to the rules and regulations of the Salem Park Commission.
955.02 TRUCKS ON PARK STREETS PROHIBITED.
   Trucks shall be prohibited on the streets and alleys within the parks,
except when making deliveries.
955.03 HOURS.
   No person nor vehicle shall be permitted to remain in the parks between the
hours of 10:00 p.m. and 7:00 a.m., except by special permission of the Park
Commission or the Parks Director.
(Ord. 161101-61. Passed 11-1-16.)
955.04 PROHIBITED CONDUCT
   The following shall be prohibited within the parks:
   (a)    Disorderly conduct or immoral acts.
   (b)    Persons under the influence of intoxicating liquors.
   (c)    Loud or indecent language.
   (d)    Gambling or games of chance.
   (e)    Soliciting for profit.
   (f)    Dogs running at large.
   (g)    Dumping or deposition of refuse, garbage or offensive substances,
except in containers provided for the same.
   (h)    Possession by any person of any beverage containing more than one
percent (1%) alcohol by volume.
   (i)    Washing or polishing of motor vehicles.
   (j)    Damage of any kind to trees, plants, grass, flowers, structures or
other public property.
   (k)    Playing tennis outside of tennis courts or being on the tennis courts
unless wearing tennis shoes. (Ord. 190102-03. Passed 1-2-19.)
955.05 ACTIVITIES REQUIRING WRITTEN PERMISSION.
   The following shall be prohibited within the parks of the City unless
written permission is first obtained from the park custodian:
   (a)    Riding, leading or permitting horses or ponies at any place, except
on roadways.
   (b)    Keeping or offering anything for sale.
   (c)    Posting or displaying any sign, banner or advertising.
   (d)    Delivering of any public speech.
   (e)    Obstructing a roadway or pathway.
   (f)    Discharging of firearms or fireworks or sending up any balloons.
   (g)    Holding of picnics at places not designated by the Park Commission
for that purpose
   (h)    Holding any public meetings or engaging in marching or driving as
members of a military, political or other organization.
   (i)    Building any fire except at places provided for that purpose.
   (j)    Trespassing upon premises where signs containing the words "no
admittance" or "private" shall be displayed.
   (k)    Playing of baseball, tennis or any other game at a place not
designated for that purpose.
   (1)    Entering or leaving the parks except at established ways of entrance
or exit.
   (m)    Carrying or conveying any shrubs, flowers, firearms, slingshots,
saws, shovels or spades.
   (n)    Tear down, remove or deface any sign or notice properly posted.
955.06 SPEED LIMITS.
   No person shall operate any motor vehicle at a speed greater than ten miles
per hour within any park in the City. The Park Commission shall cause proper
signs to be posted at the entrance ways to the parks.
955.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a minor
misdemeanor. Each day on which a violation occurs or continues shall be deemed
a separate offense.
CHAPTER 959
Reservoir Recreational Areas
959.01    Location.
959.02   Custody and control.
959.03   Rules and regulations.
959.04   Personnel.
959.05   Posting of rules and regulations.
959.06   Enforcement.
959.07   Compliance required.
959.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Playgrounds - see Ohio R.C. 755.12 et seq.
Parks-see S.U. & P.S. Ch.
955
 
959.01 LOCATION.
   There are established parks and recreation areas located at the Salem City
Reservoir, which shall include the land areas surrounding the East Cold Run
Reservoir also known as The Salem City Lake and the Salem Eagleton Glenn
property also known as The Covered Bridge.
(Ord. 090519-34. Passed 5-19-09.) 
959.02 CUSTODY AND CONTROL.
   (a)   The care, custody and control of such land areas shall be and is
placed under control of the Salem Parks Commission. 
   (b)    The Salem Utilities Commission by Ohio Revised Code Chapters 735 and
743 manages and supervises the water and land areas under the control of the
Salem Utilities Commission. The land areas designated above in Section
959.01 as well as the Lake/Reservoir and all waterways associated therewith are
on property designated as Utilities Commission property. The Utilities
Commission does for the land areas described in Section
959.01 and for such other land areas as they may so designate in the future,
authorizes said properties to be supervised and maintained by the Board of
Parks Commissioners for public park purposes for purposes not inconsistent with
state law , City ordinances or rules or regulations set forth by the Salem
Utilities Commission.
(Ord. 090519-34. Passed 5-19-09.)
959.03 RULES AND REGULATIONS.
   (a)    The operation of the recreational facilities, including the fees to
be charged and the rules and regulations necessary to be promulgated, shall be
accomplished by written rules and regulations set forth by the Salem Park
Commission.
   (b)    The rules and regulations established by the Salem Park Commission
shall be subject to approval by the Salem Utilities Commission in their
promulgation and enforcement.
(Ord. 650615-61. Passed 6-15-65.)
959.04 PERSONNEL.
   The Salem Park Commission shall employ personnel necessary to maintain and
operate the facilities and to enforce the rules and regulations governing same.
(Ord. 650615-61. Passed 6-15-65.)
959.05 POSTING OF RULES AND REGULATIONS.
   The rules and regulations, when promulgated by the Salem Park Commission and
approved by the Utilities Commission, shall be conspicuously posted at all
entrances and around the grounds of the recreation area and shall be available
upon request by persons wishing to use the facilities. A certified copy of the
rules and regulations so promulgated and approved shall be kept on file in the
office of the Clerk of Council and available for public inspection at any
reasonable time.
(Ord. 650615-61. Passed 6-15-65.)
959.06 ENFORCEMENT.
   The person placed in charge of the operation of the facilities shall be
deputized by the proper officials in order to permit them to enforce this
chapter and the rules and regulations promulgated for the facilities.
(Ord 650615-61. Passed 6-15-65.)
959.07 COMPLIANCE REQUIRED.
   No person shall violate any of the terms of this chapter or the rules and
regulations promulgated by the Salem Park Commission and approved by the Salem
Utilities Commission.
(Ord. 650615-61. Passed 6-15-65)
959.99 PENALTY.
   (a)    Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a minor
misdemeanor. Each day on which a violation occurs or continues is deemed a
separate offense.
   (b)    In addition to the penalty in subsection (a) hereof, the offender
shall receive a revocation of his privilege to use the facilities for a period
not to exceed one year, and shall be required to replace any property damaged
by him.
CHAPTER 961
Excavations
961.01    Right of way excavations permit required.
961.02    Permit fees.
961.03    Long line permit; fees.
961.04    Restoration of openings; fees.
961.05    Openings in new pavements.
961.06    Emergency openings.
961.07    Liability and bond requirements.
961.08    Traffic control notice to the City Director of Public Service and
Safety.
961.09    Disposition of excavated materials.
961.99    Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Liability for damage - see Ohio R.C. 723.49 et seq.
961.01 RIGHT OF WAY EXCAVATION PERMIT REQUIRED.
   (a)    A right of way excavation permit issued by the City Zoning Officer,
or their designated agent shall be required of all firms, corporations,
companies or individuals prior to any excavation being performed in a street,
alley or other public right of way in the City, whether in the paved portion of
the right of way or not, for the purpose of maintaining, replacing,
constructing, repair or rehabilitation of all underground lines, conduits,
mains, structures, manholes, hand holes, lamp holes or other subsurface
installations, except work which is being done and paid for as a part of a
construction contract with the City.
   (b)    No person or entity shall commence any excavation in the City of
Salem without complying with the rules and requirements of the Ohio Utilities
Protection Service. All right of way excavation permits shall be obtained at
least forty-eight (48) hours prior to the beginning of the work unless work is
of an emergency nature where special permission may be given by the City Zoning
Officer, or the Utilities Superintendent. Right of way excavation permits shall
be valid for the time limit shown on the permit. If the entity performing the
right of way excavation fails to complete satisfactory restoration of the area
as set out in Section
961.04  of this Chapter, within thirty (30) days of the expiration of the right
of way excavation permit, they shall, in addition to any other penalties, be
subject to a fifty dollars ($50.00) per day penalty until such time as the
restoration is satisfactorily completed.
(Ord. 250128-08. Passed 2-4-25.)
961.02 PERMIT FEES.
   Fees for right of way excavation permits shall be paid, upon application, to
the City Zoning Officer, or their designated agent in accordance with the
following schedule:
The following permit fees are for a single opening and excavation of up to
fifty (50) linear feet in length.
   (a)   Limited Access Expressways         $500.00
   (b)    Major Streets               $100.00
   (c)    Secondary Major Streets         $50.00
   (d)    Central Business District Streets      $100.00
   (e)   Residential Streets and All Others      $25.00
   (f)    Limited access expressways shall be as defined by the Ohio Revised
Code, major streets are those that have a state route designation, and
secondary major streets are those that do not have a state route designation
but have commercial and industrial properties or businesses within one thousand
(1,000) feet of the proposed excavation. The Central Business District streets
are those streets set out in the Central Business District as defined in this
Code, including any boundary streets associated therewith. As some designations
may be overlapping for certain areas of the City of Salem, the permit fee shall
be pursuant to the highest designation associated with the street subject to
the proposed excavation.
   (g)    No permit shall be issued to any person or entity unless the person
or entity requesting the permit designates a single point of contact for a
person that can be reached twenty four (24) hours a day to address any problems
that may arise from the excavation.
      (Ord. 250128-08. Passed 2-4-25.)
961.03 LONG LINE PERMIT; FEES.
   A long line right of way excavation permit shall be issued by the City
Zoning Officer, or their designated agent to cover work considered to be of a
continuous nature over a relatively long length of right of way, specifically
including, but not limited to, the installation of new lines, piping or
conduits or the replacement of lines, piping or conduits where the length of
the work exceeds fifty (50) linear feet. Fees for a long line permit shall be
paid, upon application, to the City Zoning Officer in accordance with the
following schedule:
   Long Line Permit Fees Per Opening
   (a)   Limited Access Expressways         $1,000.00*
   (b)    Major Streets               $200.00*
   (c)   Secondary Major Streets         $100.00*
   (d)    Central Business District Streets      $200.00*
   (e)    Residential Streets and All Others      $50.00*
   (f)    *Plus $25.00 for every fifty (50) foot section after the initial
fifty (50) feet covered by the base permit fee and $10.00 for each additional
opening after the first made anywhere along the long line excavation.
Inspection charges shall be the responsibility of the party requesting the
excavation permit and shall be due and payable upon invoice by the Zoning
Officer and shall be kept current. The City will contract with an engineering
firm familiar with the City infrastructure and codes, for inspection purposes.
The estimated cost for inspection services from the engineering firm shall be
paid in advance by the person or entity requesting the long line excavation
permit and will be paid out to the engineering firm by the City Auditor
pursuant to invoicing from the engineering firm for the inspection work as it
is done. Any unused balance remaining at the conclusion of the project which
was deposited for inspection shall be returned to the permit holder. If issues
arise that require additional inspection, then the permit holder shall deposit
any amount estimated by the engineer to continue the project associated with
the excavation. The failure to deposit or maintain current inspection fees will
be just cause for the refusal of all future permits of any type and the
revocation of any current permits. Detailed plans governing long line work
shall be submitted at least ten days prior to permit application for approval
by the Zoning Officer, or their designated agent. No permit governing this work
will be issued prior to approval of detailed plans. Plan approval includes
location of work, methods of construction, types of materials, pedestrian and
vehicular traffic controls, types of pavement restoration, lawn restoration,
time limits and any other requirement deemed necessary to insure the public
health, safety and welfare.
   (g)    No permit shall be issued to any person or entity unless the person
or entity requesting the permit designates a single point of contact for a
person that can be reached twenty four (24) hours a day to address any problems
that may arise from the excavation.
      (Ord. 250128-08. Passed 2-4-25.)
961.04 RESTORATION OF OPENINGS; FEES.
   (a)   Restoration of all openings in pavement areas shall be performed by
the applicant. All restoration, whether in paved areas or unpaved areas, and
whether they are in street-opening-permit areas or long line permit areas,
shall be in accordance with the ordinances of the City of Salem, the
requirements of the Ohio Revised Code, or those deemed applicable to the
condition of the excavated area as determined by the Zoning Officer, or their
designated agent. The City shall reserve the right to repair or replace any
restored area which is not deemed acceptable by the Zoning Officer, or their
designated agent and assess all costs including a fifteen percent (15%)
administrative fee to the applicant.
   (b)   When restorations are made by the City, the applicant shall be
assessed the actual cost of the restoration, including all labor, material and
equipment costs including an administrative charge of fifteen percent (15%).
Payment for restoration charges shall be kept current or existing or future
permits may be revoked or denied. In the event that a restoration being
performed by the applicant is not proceeding satisfactorily, the Zoning
Officer, or their designated agent may order the work performed by City forces
with charges assessed as described in this section. A penalty of fifty dollars
($50.00) a day may be assessed against the permit holder for each day beyond
the permit deadline that street openings are not available for restoration by
the Street Department.
(Ord. 250128-08. Passed 2-4-25.)
961.05 OPENINGS IN NEW PAVEMENTS.
   New pavements shall be considered those pavements which have been newly
constructed in part, or in total or newly resurfaced in part, or in total in
the five-year period prior to the permit application date.
   Permit fees for openings in new pavements shall be five (5) times the normal
fee as outlined in Section
961.02 , and permits in new pavements shall be issued only with written
approval of the Zoning Officer, or their designated agent. The increase in fee
shall not apply to inspection charges or restoration charges.
   In the case of long line permits in new pavements, the fee shall be five (5)
times the normal fee as outlined in Section
961.03 , and permits shall be issued only after approval of detailed plans and
with written approval of the Zoning Officer, or their designated agent. In the
event of a long line street opening for a roadway which had been newly
constructed in part, or in total or newly resurfaced in part, or in total in
the three-year period prior to the permit application date, the Zoning Officer,
or their designated agent reserves the right to require full-width restoration
and paving of the affected area of roadway at the applicant's expense.
(Ord. 250128-08. Passed 2-4-25.)
961.06 EMERGENCY OPENINGS.
   In the event of an emergency, or where the public health, safety and welfare
are involved, street openings may be made immediately by the proper authority
provided, however, that immediate notification be given to the Zoning Officer,
or their designated agent. The intent of this section is the waiver of prior
application and approvals by the Zoning Officer, or their designated agent. In
no case is it intended that permit fees, restoration fees or inspection fees be
waived. These are computed and levied as previously described in the above
various sections. (Ord. 250128-08. Passed 2-4-25.)
961.07 LIABILITY AND BOND REQUIREMENTS.
   (a)    All firms, corporations, companies or individuals seeking the
issuance of a permit for performance of any of the services or work above set
out shall, at the time before a permit is issued, furnish a liability insurance
rider or policy of liability insurance, against personal liability and/ or
property damage, indemnifying the City against all loss as a result of their
performance under such permit in sums of one hundred thousand dollars
($100,000) to three hundred thousand dollars ($300,000) for personal injury and
fifty thousand dollars ($50,000) to one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) for
property damage as the Zoning Officer or their designated agent deems
appropriate.
   (b)    Before any right of way excavation permit is issued, the applicant
shall post a performance bond in such conditions as the Zoning Officer, or his
designated agent deems appropriate. In the event an applicant or their
contractor fails to complete the project, make repairs, or provide restoration
within thirty (30) days from the permit expiration date, the bonding company
shall have the necessary repairs, restoration or project completed. Failure of
the bonding company to proceed within seven (7) days of notice shall be cause
for the City to complete the repairs at the bonding company's expense as set
out in Section
961.04 , and for the revocation of the permit of the applicant and for any such
other remedy allowed by these ordinances and/or the State of Ohio.
(Ord. 250128-08. Passed 2-4-25.)
961.08 TRAFFIC CONTROL NOTICE TO THE CITY DIRECTOR OF PUBLIC SERVICE AND
SAFETY.
   No permit holder for right of way excavation shall commence any excavation
work without first notifying the Director of Public Service and Safety or the
City Chief of Police that such work is about to be commenced. The permit holder
shall be responsible for all traffic control issues in accordance with the
rules and regulations of the City of Salem as set out in the ordinances or
designated by the Director of Public Service and Safety or the Chief of Police.
(Ord. 250128-08. Passed 2-4-25.)
961.09 DISPOSITION OF EXCAVATED MATERIALS.
   (a)   All earth, cinder, ashes, stone, brick or other material excavated
while street improvements are being made shall, if possible, be replaced
therein; if not possible, it shall be removed from the streets by the person
making the improvement or doing the work, immediately upon the completion of
the same.
   (b)   Stockpiling and storing of dirt or excavated material from building
excavations, street or sewer excavations, on residentially zoned areas other
than on the prime construction site and immediate adjacent areas is prohibited.
The area surrounding the prime construction site and adjacent sidewalks and
streets shall be kept clean of all dirt and material until the completion of
the project and the restoration of the area.
(Ord. 250128-08. Passed 2-4-25.)
961.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter for which no other penalty is
provided is guilty of a misdemeanor of the fourth degree. Whoever violates
Section 961.09(b) is guilty of a misdemeanor of the third degree.
(Ord. 250128-08. Passed 2-4-25.)

CODIFIED ORDINANCES OF SALEM
PART ELEVEN - PLANNING AND ZONING CODE
TITLE ONE - Subdivision Regulations
Chap.
1101.    Purpose; Scope.
